dialogues.text: What brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: pal’ s training to kick your boy’s the feathers. Again. Paulie and Red recognize Dag Paulie’s eyes narrow -- Red’ double-comb stands up like demon-horns.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Oh, the battling busboy - You know you jest, got lucky, don’tcha? You can’t beat ed in a fair fight.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Red? From Pluckett’s? (makes a connection) Did you steal my Penny?!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Whoa, my boy didn’t steal nothin’. But if you're that hard up for cash... (flips Dag a coin) Here’s a whole nickel.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: I mean my girl Penny! At Pluckett’s!

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: (taunting) Hey, all the hens go for me. I don’t always get their names. Both roosters drop into fighting stance and face off, circling. Paulie and Mack move to pull their fighters apa

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, save it for the ring.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (Mr. T) I pity the fool fights us!

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: (Brando) Yeah? My boy’s gonna be a contender!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (Brando) With a one-way ticket to Palookaville, he’s a bum, is what he is!

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Huh. Dueling Brandos. Now Paulie and Mack are facing off like their fighters...

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: (Clint) Ya feeling lucky, Punk? Well are ya?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (Clint) Go ahead -- make my day.  46. -and the roosters have to pull them apart. As Dag pulls Mack and Red drags Paulie away...

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: (Arnold) Hasta la vista, baby!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (Arnold) Ve'll be back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocky watches dubiously as Dag works out on a punching-ba a STUFFED RUBBER CHICKEN hanging from a jungle-gym bar.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Okay, take a break. Your heart ain’t really in this, is it? (Dag shakes his head no) Just as well, it ain’t something wanna do forever. Don’t wanna end up punch— drunk. I know some old roosters can’t tell a chicken from an egg. Much less which came first. They start forgetting things, repeating themselves, and you know... forgetting things, repeating themselves. (off Dag’s reaction) Joke. I was lucky, I got outta the game before I got too goofy. But the sooner your re out, the better. Okay, tr _this -- hink about somebody you’re mad a’ Dag squints at the punching bag, where PENNY’S FACE appea

dialogues.speaker: COCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somebody you really hate. Dag shakes his head -- he doesn’t really hate Penny. So h imagines RED next to Penny on the punching-bag, grinning he wraps a wing around her. Dag snarls. His coxcomb rises. He pulls back and PUNCHES! The bag goes spinning around the bar.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's more like it. As Dag punches the bag harder and faster...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - AFTERNOON Penny dozes in her cramped cage as LOUD MACHINERY grinds gear. Her gage bounces and starts to move. Other hens sta to SQUAWK wildly. What’s going on WIDE-SHOT of the plant shows a whole row of cages now mov on a conveyor belt, toward a CHUTE. A METAL DOOR ROLLS UP reveal a glimpse of the PROCESSING PLANT beyond-- flicker red shadows and an INFERNAL CACOPHONY of CLANGING MACHINE REVEAL Penny’s in a row of cages moving toward the chute.  47. IN THE FRONT CAGE - A terrified hen presses into the back wall of her cage, SQUAWKING... POV SHOT - through cage bars, crawling like a roller-coas before the plunge. We move inexorably to the edge of the belt -- TIP off -- land with a CLANG in the chute -- and slide down, down into the gaping maw of the processing pl PENNY cowers in her moving cage, covering her ears agains the din of GRINDING GEARS and CRAZED CHICKENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocky watches Dag tapping lamely at the bag.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: You don’t exactly have the killer instinct, do ya?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: I tried to tell them, I’m a...

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Lover not a fighter, yeah, okay, Plan B. You like music, right? So let’s teach you to dance.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A RECORD spinning on old phonograph near the ring. A scra version of NEW BIRD IN TOWN plays. Cocky and Dag sing as they dance around the ring. Cocky feints and keeps the rhythm as Dag ducks and skips away.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: New bird in town... Stronger each minute... I'm gonna win it!

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Keep moving. . « turn! Keep your head down! Dag ducks -- then looks up to Cocky for approval. Instead POW! He gets a glove to the beak.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got a lot to learn.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: (dazed and exhausted) Whew -- I can’t keep this up all night.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: You won’t have to.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A BAGFUL OF COLORFUL SEEDS as Cocky spills some to show D

dialogues.speaker: COCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's that chicken-speed I told ya about.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Van daan't+ want ma ta nea i+!  48.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Nah, that’s the beauty part, you don’t need it. Most of these daybirds have to use something, just to keep ‘em going. He points out other ROOSTERS around gym -- ONE is gobblin chicken-speed -- ANOTHER guzzles from a “Starcock’s” cup third is bending over to get an injection in his tailfeat from a STORK, who uses a reluctant hummingbird as a needl

dialogues.speaker: COCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chicken-speed... caffeine-a-cino... rooster-booster shots. Now let’s gay somehow they don’t get the right pick-me- up to wake ‘em up... they’1ll run outta steam in no time. All you gotta do is keep dancing til they droop, then-- blam! Go in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: But isn’t that cheating?

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: The guys who use this stuff are cheating. We’re just-- un-cheating. You heard of the rope-a-dope? Well, this is the just- say-nope-to-dope. Dag smiles, starting to get the idea... INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - DUSK The machinery stops CLANGING -- the cages stop moving -- chickens settle. In her cage, Penny sighs with relief... until she sees -- she’s now just a few cages away from the fatal drop-off.

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: Aw Dag, where are you? The question echoes in the sudden silence. Then...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Penny? Penny looks up -- did she really hear that?

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: Dag?!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nah, it’s just me... We TRACK up a long duct, through fan blades to find... EXT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - ROOFTOP - DUSK HOMER on the roof, calling down through an air vent.

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: .-Homer.  49. In b.g. fans spin, chimneys spew smoke and that big billb keeps cranking -- a NOISY MOTOR moves giant Pluckett’s gi hand, lifting that giant drumstick up and down and up.

dialogues.speaker: PENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Homer? Oh thank goodness, where’s Dag?

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: Um, he can’t make it, Pen, he’s uh, ina little jam of his own, but never fear, Homer’s here, I’m gonna get you out!

dialogues.speaker: PENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: . -How? Her plaintive question echoes up the vent -- how, how, ho

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: Right. How. He looks down the vent -- fan blades block the way. Looks around the roof -- smokestacks belching smoke... a few se skylights... no way in or out. Suddenly the roof RUMBLES fan blades spin faster-- the plant’s cranking up again... INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY Penny’s cage STARTS MOVING on the conveyor . As the cages ahead of her head for the Chute of Death... uelp! PENNY (0.S.) EXT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - ROOFTOP - DUSK Homer launches into the air, flies to... THE BACK OF THE BILLBOARD -- where a motor turns a rubber belt that moves the giant hand out front. Homer lands on the moving belt... skitters... then clamps claws around the belt. He beats his wings against the air he strains to pull the belt off its gears... -and finally yanks it off-center, onto the sharp edge of gear. The belt starts to SHRED... then RIPS! Homer wildly backwards and does a midair somersault to avoid t torn belt snapping back at him. ON THE BILLBOARD - The giant hand falls iinp, and the hug drumstick drops out... CRASH! Through a skylight, into... INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - CONTINUOUS Glass SHATTERS and the big drumstick falls straight into main bank of CONVEYOR BELT GEARS -- which GRIND and SCREE chewing up the drumstick til only the bone sticks out. The conveyor belts lurch to a stop... and so does Penny’s cage, teetering on the edge of doom. A moment of silence, then... the CHICKENS erupt in giddy CHEERS AND LAUGHTER. Homer flutters down from the broken skylight...

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: Homer! Over here!  50. He flies to join her, lands on atop her cage -- the wrong end, making it tilt over the edge. So he hops to the othe side, weighting it down.

dialogues.speaker: PENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: _. HOMER
dialogues.text: Let’s just get -- you -- outta -- here. He pulls on the bars of Penny’s cage, trying to widen the gap... can’t do it. Turns to the door -- sticks his beak into the keyhole, tries to pick the lock... and gets stuc Struggles to free his beak, pushing against the cage with claws. POP! He’s free... but the cage tips dangerously. Homer flattens his back against the cage and, flapping valiantly, pushes it back to safe ground. Whew. Then... The MAIN DOOR of the plant ROLLS UP to admit Pluckett and Men, checking out the noise. As usual, Paulie rides on Pluckett’s Shoulder while Red and General Lee follow at h heels. The Men tote rifles and flashlights, spraying brig beams around the cages like searchlights at a prison brea

dialogues.speaker: CAP'N PLUCKETT
dialogues.text: What in tarnation....?! He sees the drumstick and the damage done. Hears chickens still cheering and laughing. CAP‘N PLUCKETT (CONT’D) Awright, hush, ya dumb clucks! One Man SHOOTS into the air. BLAM! The chickens go silent CAP'N PLUCKETT (CONT’D) That’s better. Now how soon can we fix this mess and git up and runnin’ again? We got chickens to fry Penny looks at Homer anxiously. He looks back helplessly. then ducks behind her cage as flashlight beams sweep past MUSIC UNDER: the OPENING FANFARE of the “ROCKY” THEME.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: DAG'S TRAINING MONTAGE - MUSIC builds as we find Dag at..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes against a bar attached to the layground whirlyg while he runs in circles. Cocky rides the whirlygig, crow encouragement along with the MUSIC:

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Gonna fly now! Gonna fly now!

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: (panting) Very... funny... ANOTHER PART OF THE GYM - Mack and Cocky | watch Dag poun tha rnhhar chiakan unanthneiactinally Cacky etane  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack's intrigued, Dag puzzled as Cocky leads them through fence-bars, into the dark, looming building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelves and racks full of gag toys. Cocky leads Dag to an area where rubber chickens hang with other birds like the slabs of beef in Rocky Balboa’s freezer. Dag checks out t rubber roosters... ducks... BATS. Dag’s eyes narrow ... BLAM-BLAM-BLAM - Dag beats up on a rubber bat with new ferocity, as Cocky shouts encouragement. ANOTHER PART OF THE WAREHOUSE - Mack’s in prankster heave he’s surprised by a pair of wind-up teeth... fooled by a of fake vomit... delighted by a shelf of whoopie cushions which FART-FART-FART as Mack hops from one to the next. LATER - the rubber bat is in shreds as Dag cools down, co massaging his shoulders. Mack raises a camera to capture moment. Dag and Cocky smile -- and get SPRAYED WITH PATER from Mack’s gag camera. AT THE CITY LIBRARY - Dag looks up at the endless stairwa leading up to the library entrance. Dag looks at Cogky -- can’t do this. cocky urges him on. Dag jogs forward... th backward to tell Cocky -- nope, really can’t do this. “Co pushes him forward... and Dag starts up the” stairs. AT THE GYM - Cocky sits on a see-saw while Dag strains to push the other end down -- lifting Cocky into the air. BACK AT THE LIBRARY - Dag’s running up those stairs again breathing hard, eyes closed. He hits a landing -- stops - turns -- opens his eyes to see Cocky, way down at the bot of the stairs, cheering him on. Dag grins, turns back, lo up -- then sags as he sees... the ENDLESS STAIRWAY upward It looks longer than ever. AT THE GYM - Cocky and Mack give Dag a leopard-spotted, hooded boxer’s robe. Dag unfurls d2 to reveal the name on the back: KID_ BANTAM. Cocky and Mack turn to reveal thei jackets are also proudly emblazoned KID BANTAM. THE MUSIC CRESCENDOES as we hit the library stairs again POV shot climbing up, up, up... to the top of the stairs! spin to see the WHOLE CITY spread out below. REVEAL. We're sharing the POV of a HUMAN BOXER (call him “ROCKY.” He raises his arms in triumph, on top the world. Then... “ROCKY” Yo! Check out the chicken! And here comes Dag, dragging and_ huffing up the final fe stairs. He hits the top and collapses, exhausted. “ROCKY” (CONT'D) Yo, you got a lotta noive, boid. picks . Dag up... and raises the rooster over his head, a dou le-victory gesture. Dag grins goofily as Rocky jumps.  52. DAG'S POV - the whole city rolling out below him as the R THEME CLIMAXES and our musical sequence ends...

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Hey Cocky, I’m flyin’! I’m flyin’!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Homer lands -- looks around til he spots -- a figure i that hooded “Kid Bantam” robe, shadow-boxing in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: Hey, Dag., Don’t turn around, I can’t look you in the eye, just listen. Penny didn't really write that letter about Red and “don’t come back,” the truth is, she’s in trouble, Dag, big.. The figure turns to reveal the face under the hood. It’s Dag -- it’s Johnny Guano. Gulp.

dialogues.speaker: HOMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .-trouble. Hiya Johnny, that robe looks good on you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY GUANO
dialogues.text: Hiya -- stool pigeon. You know what happens to stool pigeons?

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: They get their wings clipped? Johnny smiles -- showing his FANGS. As he closes in on Homer, we hear RADIO STATIC and RAT-A-TAT-A-TAT sound FX.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY WINCHELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They call him Kid Bantam, the newest student of the sweet science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestled in an antenna tower, Radio KJAY is on the air. Wo pecker WOODY WINCHELL punctuates his patter with PECKING.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY WINCHELL
dialogues.text: ...who graduates to the pros tonight. (PECK-PECK-PECK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trained by woot, Cacciatore, three-time- champ from way-back-when... (PECK- n PECK- PECK) Kid Bantam is fresh meat, +or should I say poultry, and he’s likel 9gt tenderized by tough bir Keo lo Loco, a-k- a the Mexican Madman. Who will slaughter whom? Yours truly Woody Winchell will be there to find out, see you at the fights! Woody DINGS a BELL and starts a record playing. MUSIC UP ("NEW BIRD IN TOWN”) as we DISSOLVE INTO: A GOOD OLD-FASHIONED BOXING MOVIE MONTAGE - in SEPIA TONE and BLACK-AND-WHITE, with the occasional splatter of RED.  53. A FIGHT POSTER SPINS TOWARDS US - Spotlit at the bottom o the card: APOLLO LOCO v. KID BANTAM. BLINDING FLASHBULBS EXPLODE as Dag heads into the arena, wearing his “KID BANTAM” robe. IN THE LOCKER ROOM - Mack opens Apollo’s locker -- finds sack of chicken- speed -- switches it for an identical ba He slips behind the lockers as APOLLO appears in trunks a robe -- grabs the bag -- and gulps down its useless conte AT THE BOXING RING - Dag and Cocky climb through the rope take their corners. Woody sits_at the press table ringsid The Referee is Cooney -- while Poss holds up the round-ca LATER - The audience full of birds CHEERS as Dag evades Apollo's punches. Excited Flo sits next to worried Mack. WHAM! Apollo lands a punch -- Dag spins backwards. Grabs the ropes for support as Apollo moves in...

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: New bird in town, Full of high hopes now... Oof! On the ropes now, Can he return? New bird in town, he's got a lot to... DING! The bell sounds, Dag and Apollo return to their corners. Cocky waters Dag down and tends his wound.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: He’s not... getting... tired...

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Hang in there. DING! Apollo aims a punch -- Dag ducks -- Apollo stumbles off-balance. Shakes his head, blinks -- getting sleepy. H looks around -- where’s the other guy? -- just as Dag pop from below with an uppercut -- SMACK! Apollo crashes to the ground. Referee Cooney counts... an ten! He’s out! The referee lifts winner Dag’s wing as Coc and Dag’s fans in the audience CHEER wildly. AT BIRDLAND - a champagne bottle POPS Open as Mack, Flo, Artie, Bats, even Johnny celebrate Dag’s victory. ANOTHER SPINNING FIGHT-CARD -- Dag’s moving up on the fig card: SUGAR RAY LEGHORN v. KID BANTAM. Dissolve to: THE GYM WHIRLYGIG - OVERHEAD SHOT - Cocky rides the carou as Dag runs and pushes, dissolving into: THE ROULETTE WHEEL at Nero’s Castle -- where slightly slo Cocky and Flo are winning, dissolving into... THE DANCE FLOOR at Birdland -- OVERHEAD SHOT, as Dag and spin around the floor in one another’s wings. OUTSIDE NERO’S -- Cooney and Poss hold flashlights, sweep them back and forth like searchlights over the Sewer Stri Crowds of nightbirds push toward the entrance, under a marauis that savs: TONIGHT! KID BANTAM V. CLUCKER LANG.  54. IN THE LOCKER ROOM - CLUCKER LANG is a huge black rooster with his coxcomb plastered into a Mr. T. mohawk. His big of Starcock’s coffee sits on a table next to him. Mack_approaches with his own cup. He peels off the “DECAF label and places his cup on the table next to Clucker’s. Mack points at something to distract Clucker. The big rooster looks away -- Mack switches coffee-cups. But Clucker suspects the switch, points to distract Mack. and switches the cups back. Mack points again -- this tim he doesn’t switch. When Clucker repeats the gag and switc the cups, he ends up with Mack’s decaf. IN NERO’S ARENA - Dag and Clucker slug it out. Dag’s on t ropes -- only saved by the BELL. He staggers back to his corner, where Cocky sponges his black eye... DING! The bell rings -- Dag rises -- but Clucker doesn’t. The big guy has dozed off on_his stool. Clucker’s TRAINER tries to rouse him -- but only succeeds in pushing him of the stool. Clucker falls flat on the canvas, sound asleep Dag raises both wings, parades around the ring, victoriou AT BIRDLAND - FLASHBULBS POP and nightbird FANS surround now wearing a two-tone Ricky Ricardo jacket and a big shi Mack approaches for a congratulatory ug -- but Dag shines him on as he pushes ahead toward Flo, o waits with wings outstretched. They hug as Mack watches, hurt. Dag grabs a bottle of champagne from the tray of a passing Waitbird.. POP! The bottle overflows with happy bubbles as MUSIC FAD

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. DON OWLEONE’S PENTHOUSE Owleone’s opening the Don’s Perignon and filling acorn-cu as Bats finishes counting money.

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: All here, boss. As everyone takes a cup of champagne, Owleone raises his.

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: We never doubted you-hoo. To Kid Bantam! Flo, Mack, Cocky, Bats and Johnny join the toast.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: And to the happy end of a great career.

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: “End?” Who-hoo said anything about end?

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Well, Dag did, remember? He’s gonna quit fighting once his debt’s paid, which is now, SO... (lifts cup) Ta-daaa!  55.

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: Quit now? You gotta be kidding. (wing around Dag) You're just getting started, aren’tcha?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Come on, Mack, I can’t stop now. The championship, you know what that means?

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: A million smacker purse is what it means.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, of which you get what?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Twenty percent. Almost half, right? Owleone, Bats and Johnny all nod vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: But you’re a lover -- not a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: (hugs Flo) Gee, Mack... can’t I be both?

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: Attaboy. To the next World Champion! Flo cuddles Dag as all toast -- even, reluctantly, Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dag, Mack and Cocky perch beneath a gargoyle overlooking city streets, a little worse for the champagne.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: You get it, don’tcha, Cocky? This is no time to quit.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: I gotta vote with the mockingbird on this one, kid. The longer you stay in the game, the more chance you’ll get sucker- punched in the head.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Or the heart. (off Dag’s look) Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: I could be lucky, like Cocky.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Everybody’s luck runs out sometime. Energy, too. I gotta hit the hay. And you gotta do what you gotta do. See ya tomorrow, kid. Cocky moves off into the shadows beneath the gargoyles...  56.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Listen, Mack, now I can start making some real money. Even keep some of it!

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: (nods, deadpan) Almost half.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: And that won’t hurt, with Flo and all.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, no dough, no Flo.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Yeah...Hey, whaddya mean? You saying Flo only loves for my money?

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Not only. (Robin Leach) There’s also the free fight tickets, the best tables and all the fabulous perks of the lifestyle of the rich and famous. You think she’ s some kind of... fly-by- night... golddigger?

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: No! I know she is.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Take it back.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Kid, I’m only trying to...

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: (collars Mack) Take it back!

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Okay, okays Flo’s a peach, she loves you just for being you.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: (ignores sarcasm, lets him go) That’s more like it.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: But ya still oughta quit fighting.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: ripsy anger) Yeah (he 1, you know what you oughta do? You oughta stop telling me what I oughta do is what you oughta do. Just keep your thousand voices to yourself and let me find my own!

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: You’re not gonna find it with a muzzle on your beak.  57.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: I’m a big bird, Mack, I don’t need you crowding me all the time.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: -..Well, I don’t wanna crowd ya, kid. Ya don’t have to worry about that anymore. He stands, flaps his wings... and tipsily falls of the le

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Mack...! Mack rises back into view, hovering a moment...

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: So long, Dag. He flies into the night sky -- leaving Dag alone. INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - DAY Cap'n Pluckett inspects the fixed machinery.

dialogues.speaker: CAP'N PLUCKETT
dialogues.text: She’s ready to go? Off his Foreman’s nod, Pluckett flips the ON switch. The gears and belts WHIR into action. Penny reacts in terror as her cage starts to move... off end of the conveyor belt... toward the Chute of Doom. Pen sticks her feet through thé bars and frantically runs aga the moving belt... but she can’t hold out much longer.. CAP‘N PLUCKETT (CONT’D) Okay, shut her down. The machinery stops. Penny collapses, relieved. CAP’ N PLUCKETT (CONT’D) Quittin’ time, boys we got_a big night ahead. Y’all ready to rumble? Pluckett’s men WHOOP and rush to new tasks -- transformin the plant into an arena. SERIES OF DISSOLVES: As some men set up a cockfighting ring... others set up risers and chairs... some lay bets Cap’n Pluckett... and two men hoist a painted banner read WORLD BANTAMWEIGHT COCKFIGHT CHAMPIONSHIP. As Pluckett takes bets, Red and Paulie confer at his feet

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: It’s time to pick my prize, Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Okay, you can pick her -- but ya can’t do anything with her until...

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: .-after the fight, I know.  58.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (Burgess Meredith) Hens weaken legs. Hens weaken legs.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: And I know just which hen I want. (calls out) Any of you chicks know a cluck named Dag?

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: Dag? Have you seen him? Is he okay? Red zeroes in on our Penny in her cage -- calls back: Not for long, baby. I’11 see you after the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dag’s working out on the rubber-chicken punching- bag, as Cocky holds it from behind. As he jabs bag:

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Shoulda heard -- what he said -- about Flo -- who does he -- think he is anyway?

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Okay, easy, save some for the fight. (keeps "punching hard) I mean -- t nerve of -- that guy -- tellin’ me -- what to do -- and when to quit -- and who to date! Cocky sticks his head around the side of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s enough, kid... POW! Dag’s hardest punch yet connects with Cocky’s beak. Off-guard, the old rooster sprawls and lies stil

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Cocky! Aw no... He kneels at Cocky’s side -- hoists him into a sitting position -- gently smacks his face with a wingtip. DAG (CONT’D) Cocky? Come on, Cocky, wake up now... The old rooster’s eyes blink groggily open. His head’s st spinning and CARTOONISH CUCKOOS circle, COO-COOING loudly Then Cocky lifts a wing -- and SHOOS the cuckoos away.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Stupid birds.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Cocky, are you okay? (raises both wing gs) How many wings am I holding up?  59.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: That’s easy, um... you know... what’s the one between one and three? . , DAG . Stop kidding around, I’m worried.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Relax, you don’t have to worry about me. Dag breathes a sigh of relief. Then:

dialogues.speaker: COCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Relax, you don’t have to worry about me. Cuckoos gather around his head once more. As he shoos the

dialogues.speaker: COCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say kid, what’s your name again? Off Dag -- devastated by what he’s done. INT. FLO’S DRESSING ROOM As Dag barrels in, the dressing-screen wobbles -- as if someone has just rushed behind it.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Flo! You here? I really need to talk...

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: I‘1l be right out. Dag sees her robe slip off the screen... then notices a p of BOXER SHORTS also draped over the screen. The shorts a decorated with little red bats. Dag watches them slowly s behind the screen. He hides his reaction as Flo emerges. FLO (CONT’D) Hey, champ, how ya feeling?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Not so good, Flo, Cocky’s all messed _up, I think I hurt him pretty bad. And I think I just got hurt pretty bad myself. Without warning, Dag SLAMS into the screen -- pinning the behind it to the wall

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oooff. Dag lets the screen fall -- revealing Bats in his boxers.

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dag! Good to see ya, this isn’t necessarily how it looks. I was just -- inspecting the club for -- you know...

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: Moths.

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: Exactly!  60.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Yeah? Where are your clothes?

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: (pretends surprise) Man hose moths are quick. Dag looks at Flo, who shrugs sadly...

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: I said I'd be your gixt Friday, kid. But the rest of the week’s up for grabs. Too hurt to respond, Dag turns to go...

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: See ya at the fights. Forget the vee ghts! cocky was right. Mack was right. I shoulda stopped when I said I woul It's over. I quit. And he storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dag trudges alone through the streets once more... past t movie theatre ("SHE DONE HIM WRONG”)... past the newsstan ("BRETT & JENNA BREAK-UP BOMBSHELL!”). Through Dag’s eyes the Times Square signs now read: LOSER--DOOFUS--ALONE. ~ again THUNDER rumbles -- rain falls -- and a TAXI blows through puddles in front of Dag, drenching him with water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bag climbs the fire escape... past a sign pointing left: SPLANT WING... a sign pointing righ 'HERAPY WING... to chalk graffiti reading “WINGS WING.” “An arrow points UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An avian*clinic spreads across the roof -- injured birds in nests arranged around heating ducts, tended by STORK DOCTORS and NIGHTINGALE NURSES. Dag looks to find... COCKY - his head bandaged, lying in a comfy nest.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Dag! Hey kid, over here!

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Cocky! How ya doing?

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Oh, fine, the doctors are great. Except for the big bills. Get it? (off Dag’s look) I’m okay, kid. I remember my name. And yours. And you remember this guy?

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: Hiya, Dag. Homer lies in an adjoining nest, his wings in casts.  61.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Homer! What happened...

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: I had it coming, I shoulda never lied to you. Look, Penny still loves you, you gotta get to Pluckett’s and save her!

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Pluckett’s? Hey, you should be there already -- you got a big fight to fight. Dag and pals are startled by the arrival of:

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: Right. Whether you want to or not.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY GUANO
dialogues.text: Figured a sap like you would show up here. So we came to escort you to the championship.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: I told you, I’m not fighting.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY GUANO
dialogues.text: Have it your way. gohnny opens wide to reveal his gleaming fangs. Bats digs his claws into Dag’s wings as Johnny moves in for the kil

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bats! Johnny! Release that roo-hooster! The bats pull back, startled by their boss’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: But Boss, we thought...

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who-hooo told you to think? Now released, Dag can see what the bats don’t -- it’s not Owleone talking, but Mack imitating the old owl. Dag talk over Bats’s shoulder, overplaying a little:

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Thanks, Don Owleone. I’m just gonna leave now, Don Owleone...

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Dag -- whaddya mean, you’re not fighting?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: I can’t, Cocky...

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: Can't? You gotta! You promised. Lotsa folks are counting on you. Betting on you. Like me. A bird’s word is his whatchamacallit, you can’t run away now. As Dag ponders this, Johnny turns to see Mack.  62.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY GUANO
dialogues.text: Hey look...! Bats sees him, too. Mack flaps away. Before the bats can follow, they’re distracted by...

dialogues.speaker: HOMER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo Bats, Johnny! Painfully flapping his wounded wings, Homer hovers above.

dialogues.speaker: HOMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘1l show ya a stool pigeon! Bats and Johnny look up... and two BIG WHITE GLOBS of pig poop drop onto their heads. Ugh, yuk! As they wipe their eyes, Mack calls to Dag from the tlre escape:

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Let’s go, kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dag runs down the steps as Mack flies behind.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Hope I’m not crowding you.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Aw no, Mack, I’m sorry, thanks...

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: You-hoo’re very welcome.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Man, you sound just like him, it’s...

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: Spoo-hoooky? Dag runs smack into the real Don Owleone, blocking his wa the fire escape. He clutches Mack in one claw. DON OWLEONE (CONT’D) I don’t really sound like that, do-hoo I?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: hake let him go. 1’11 fight your stupid t. And after I cream that chicken, I’ a coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: I like your fu-hoory. Your limo awaits. His eyes flash as he sinks his free claw into the scruff Dag’s neck. Owleone takes off, carrying Dag and Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets below look far, far away as Owleone circles, prey swinging from his claws. Suddenly he SWOOPS DOWN... releases Dag and Homer.  63. FALLING POV -- Our heroes SQUAWK as they drop out of the and land hard, THUMP! A LID SLAMS DOWN, plunging us into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the birds’ eyes are visible.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Oof. Mack, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Umf. This is what I get for helping you. DAG ; ; Maybe we can open this thing... The eyes close as the birds GRUNT and STRAIN against the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re in a basket-trunk attached to the back of Cap'n Pluckett’s big black car. The lid pops up an inch -- but further, thanks to a big padlock. Dag and Mack’s eyes pee through the gap as the car glides away...

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Hey! Ow! What the...? Light floods in as the trunk is opened -- then tipped. Da Mack fall out into... INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - ROOSTER PEN Chicken wire covers this pen on every side and across the top, which SLAMS down. One of Pluckett’s Men padlocks it. They’re trapped. Dag looks through the wire to see... The whole vast prison of Pluckett’s Poultry. Dag is horrified -- what kind of place is this? Don Owleone steps into view, outside the wire cage.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Let us outta here!

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: Sorry, no can do-hoo. Until you do something for me -- quid pro quoo-hooo.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: I said I'd fight, what more do you want?

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: I ware, ou to lose. £ Dag’s shock) You’ fg very popular, my friend. So popular, the odds are five to two-hoo in your favor. Which means there’s more to e made betting against you-hoo.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: You can’t do that.  64.

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: I already have. I bet you’1l go down in round two-hoo. So you’re gonna go down in round two-hoo.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Throw the fight?! What do you think I am, some kind of human? No sir. You can make me fight but you can’t make me lose.

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: Oh, I think I can. He steps aside to reveal PENNY -- her wings held by Bats one side, Johnny on the other.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Penny!

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: So it’s simple -- lose the fight, or lose the chickie.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY GUANO
dialogues.text: Ready to rumble, rooster?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: (gazing at Penny) Yeah. I’m ready.

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: But Bats and Johnny are dragging her back to her cage.

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: Remember -- round two-hoo. Off Dag, torn...

dialogues.speaker: COONEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, it’s time to pay for your ride!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney takes money from ROOSTERS and other FLIGHTLESS BIR as they hop aboard a LITTLE RED WAGON. £ COONEY b Pay for your ride uy your programs place your bets! "all aboard the " championship express. Poss stands nearby, selling programs and taking bets.

dialogues.speaker: COONEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s move out. Poss climbs aboard a TRICYCLE hitched in front of the wag

dialogues.speaker: HOMER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey wait! Wait for us!  65. Here comes Homer, his wings in slings, and cocky s on foo Cooney grabs their money and helps shove them aboard.

dialogues.speaker: COONEY
dialogues.text: Okay, Poss, you peddle, I’1l push! With a mighty effort, Poss starts peddling the tricycle w Cooney pushes the wagon from the rear. AS soon as the wag gets rolling, Cooney stops pushing and hops aboard. INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY Mack is one glum prisoner as Paulie waddles up to the pen

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Always knew you’d end up asa jailbird. Sorry to hear your boy’s going down.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Only to save his hen.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Rawk! And ya know what’s funny about that? When my boy wins -- he gets the hen. Win or lose, your boy loses. Paulie laughs raucously as he waddles away. Mack turns to see Dag’s been listening. DAG ; ; In that case... I might as well win. Dag look angrier and more determined than we've ever seen him. MUSIC UP - the Intermezzo from Cavalleria Rusticana a.k.a. Theme from Raging Bull.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO
dialogues.text: SMOKY BLACK-AND-WHITE - Dag shadow-boxes alone in the rin wearing his spotted robe with the hood up, like a fowl de in the famous opening image. FREEZE-FRAME - TITLES OVER:

dialogues.speaker: WORLD BANTAMWEIGHT TITLE BOUT
dialogues.text: We begin a SERIES OF DISSOLVES in B/W SCORSESE STYLE, ful slo-mo, freeze-frames and extreme close-ups... Fight fans arrive at Pluckett’s -- shadowy humans in the bleachers, birds sitting ringside. B gang of Amore’s BATS perch on the pillars of the ring, guarding against troubl WOODY WINCHELL sits ringside, broadcasting from a wooden crate labelled PRESS BOX. Dag suits up -- Mack finishes tying the gloves, reaches f the muzzle. Dag grits his beak as Mack slips it on... Red slams back Starcock’'s coffee, one cup in each wing. WHISTLES and CHEERS as Dag appears. Blinding FLASHBULBS P FREEZE-FRAME PHOTO - Dag raising his wings, all pumped-up Dag climbs into the ring -- followed by his new corner-ma Mack, who gets awkwardly tangled in the ropes.  66. A MICROPHONE drops from above... into the paw of tonight' referee, Cooney. He even looks like a stripe-shirted ref.

dialogues.speaker: COONEY
dialogues.text: In this corner, weighing in at ten pounds six ounces -- Kid Bantam! (CHEERS )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this corner, weighing in at fourteen pounds twelve ounces, Ready Red O'Reilly! Dag and Red tap gloves in a pre-fight “handshake.” Back i his corner, Dag drops his robe. Looking good. Red drops h robe. Looking better. Plus he’s caffeinated to his coxcom which stick up like horns. The BELL DINGS. Poss holds up a sign: “ROUND ONE.” Red attacks first. Dag dances away once... twice...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY WINCHELL
dialogues.text: And the Rhode Island Redneck launches his assault... but he can’t touch the Kid, look at that chicken duck. KA-POW! Red connects. Dag STAGGERS IN SLO-MO to the ropes WOODY WINCHELL (CONT’D) Kapow and ouch, talk about cold-cocked, O’Reilly’s got the Kid on the ropes. Red POUNDS Dag -- until Dag ducks. Red keeps going lungin into the ropes -- which stretch and bounce him back... ..-but Red aims his legs squarely at Dag’s chest -- oof! sprawls onto the canvas. So begins a bruising round for D fighting as if his life, and Penny’s, depend on it. LATER - Red’s pummelling our hero hard as the BELL DINGS. WOODY WINCHELL (CONT’D What’s black and blue and has Red all over him, it’s Kid Bantam, and whew, he’s saved by the bell. In Dag's corner -- Mack band-aids Dag’s cuts and squeezes spongefuls of water over him. In Red’s corner -- Paulie rubs the rooster’s neck while R swallows more Starcock’s. DING! They're up again. Poss raises a sign: ROUND TWO. SLO-MO SHOTS of Dag taking a beating. Feathers fly and fl through the air. Red stomps on Dag’s feet and slugs him i the ropes. Dag bounces back like a rubber doll -- and Red slugs him again. It’s Looney Tunes meets Scorsese... unti Red delivers a KILLER ROUNDHOUSE PUNCH. Dag bounces and crashes to the canvas. Cooney starts counting -- one, two DAG’S BLURRY POV of the crowd -- Don Owleone, smiling. - fretful... Bats and Johnny, holding Penny in their clutch Dag struggles to get up -- four! five! The CROWD ROAR grows faint in his head, as he hears:  67.

dialogues.speaker: COCKY
dialogues.text: You can do it, kid! You can do it! Dag blinks his swollen eyes, sees... HOMER AND COCKY -- ringside, bandaged but rooting loudly.

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: Attaboy Dag, come on, get up! Seven... eight... Dag drags himself to his feet. The Ref pulls back -- the crowd GOES WILD. IN THE CROWD - Don Owleone scowls and seethes. IN THE RING -- Red moves in on wobbly Dag... but Dag crou to_ launch a head-butt into Red’s gut. Red staggers back, balance, and SLAMS into a corner post. CR-RACK. That’s go hurt. As he slides down the post, CUCKOOS circle his head IN THE CROWD - Penny’s held by Johnny and Bats, who murmu

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: He wins, you lose.

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: (shouts rebelliously) Come on, Dag -- kill him! Decimate him! In the ring, Dag looks around to find her... just as Red swats the Cuckoos and stands up. He barrels toward Dag.. who turns back in the nick of time, and drops to his knee Red’s momentum carries him forward -- he trips over Dag a CRASHES onto the canvas. Dag jumps on top of Red, pinning him down. Spectators CHEER and lean forward eagerly...

dialogues.speaker: PENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Murder him!!! SLO-MO - as Dag raises a glove to deliver the final blow. then STOPS. Instead of hitting Red, Dag sticks his glove under his other wing, yanks it off. Reactions change from YAY to HUNH? as Dag uses his free wing to remove his muzz

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: What the...? Get him, boys! The bat guards spread their wings and launch. As they swo towards Da - he CROWS. The Bats put their wings over thei ears... “drop to the ground, writhing in sonic pain. Johnny releases his grip on Penny, but Bats struggles to on. Now Flo decides to help -- she sticks her beak into Bats’ ear, and SHRIEKS a COLLORATURA HIGH NOTE. It’s more than Bats can stand -- he releases Penny, covers his ears

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: Move, girl! Go stand by your rooster. Penny flashes Flo a grateful smile -- then flaps off thro the crowd. Now Flo is startled by a voice behind her:

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: Oh, Flo, that wasn’t a very smart mooove.  68. Flo gulps as the old owl clamps a claw around her neck... In the ring, Dag leans down, beak-to-beak with Red. As he reaches under Red’s head, his opponent squirms... DAG ; ; Relax, I’m not trying to kiss ya. .-and he rips Red’s muzzle off.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: What’dja do that for?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: You’re welcome. Now crow. A beat -- then Red CROWS. A lovely, operatic tenor trill. DAG (CONT’D) Gee. That was unexpected. CAP‘N PLUCKETT Fight, dammit! Red CROWS again, right at Pluckett:

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: I always wanted to sing -- but you made me fight.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Now everybody! Make some noise! Drive these bats bats! Dag CROWS along with Red... and the other Roosters join i The cock-ophony echoes through the plant. All the bats SHRIEK and flap wildly toward for the open door. Some fly into Col. Pluckett, who whacks them away...

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: Dag!

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Penny! He sees her ringside, pulls her up into the ring. As they wrap their wings around one another...

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: You really are a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: When I’m fighting for what I love. (then, to crowd) Everybody! Listen! The Roosters stop crowing. MUSIC UP. Dag sings: "NOBODY HERE BUT US CHICKENS”.

dialogues.speaker: DAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, the clock is tickin’.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: I don’t hear nothin’.  69.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Listen, the time's running out... Suddenly everyone’s quiet -- listening to Dag.

dialogues.speaker: DAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's nobody here but us chickens-- And us chickens are stricken with doubt. Caged hens nod and murmur, “it’s true, we are.”

dialogues.speaker: DAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen! The tickin' quickens... We're sick an' we're under attack... But there's nobody here but us chickens, So it's time to stand up and fight back! ON PLUCKETT AND HIS MEN - baffled by the non-fighting coc CAP‘N PLUCKETT Fight, ya dumb clucks! What in tarnation you waiting for? BACK IN THE RING - Dag sings to Red.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Hey my fine-feathered brother, Let's stop fighting each other, Let's use our might the right way -- To fight the man!

dialogues.speaker: ROOSTERS
dialogues.text: Fight the man!

dialogues.speaker: OLD HEN
dialogues.text: But we can’t...

dialogues.speaker: ROOSTERS
dialogues.text: Yes we can!

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: (sings to crowd) No more a henhouse divided, Let's cross the road with pride -- Let's join one another And march to the other side! All the Roosters are getting excited now, CROWING enthusiastically as they batter against the chicken-wire. Cap'n Pluckett storms to the ropes, eye-to-eye with Dag.

dialogues.speaker: CAP'N PLUCKETT
dialogues.text: Who the hell you think you are, Rooster? Dag looks right back -- extends a wing to TURN UP Plucket hearing aid -- then CROWS into the speaker:

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Dagnabbit -- Shuddup! Pluckett is literally KNOCKED DOWN by Dag’s volume. The chickens CHEER. As Pluckett’s men help him to his feet.  70. CAP‘N PLUCKETT I‘1l_ kill you, bird, I will kill you and chill you and chop you into nuggets!

dialogues.speaker: ROOSTERS
dialogues.text: Shuddup! Yeah, shuddup!

dialogues.speaker: CAP'N PLUCKETT
dialogues.text: You shuddup! JI own you damn dumb birds!

dialogues.speaker: ROOSTERS
dialogues.text: Shud-dup! Shud-dup! Shud-dup! Dag’s name is becoming a gladiator rallying-cry, like “Spartacus.” As Pluckett shrinks back, Dag sings:

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Here's where the plot starts to thicken-- Here's where I give ya the scoo, There's nobody here but us chic. ens, And us chickens are flyin’ the coop!

dialogues.speaker: ROOSTERS
dialogues.text: Shuddup!

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: No, really! Chickens, no iron and brick can Keep us locked up on the shelves -- But no-one'll rescue us chickens -- Time to start stickin' up for ourselves! RIP! A corner of chicken-wire gives way under the Rooster battering. One pushes through -- then another. They grab the wire and pul as_more and more roosters break free. Bu most of the hens still cringe in their cages...

dialogues.speaker: DAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You too, hens! Make noise, get mad!

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Wanna get ‘em mad? Leave it to me. As Mack takes flight, Pluckett spots the escaping Rooster

dialogues.speaker: . CAP'N PLUCKETT
dialogues.text: Tarnation, stop ‘em! His Men grab rifles and start down from the bleachers.. High above, Mack lands near a fire-sprinkler. Plucks a pi of ACME FLASH PAPER from his pocket -- IGNITES it -- and holds the flame under the sprinkler. WHOOSH! The system starts up. Sprinklers spin and spray water over all the cages... making the hens wet, and, yes, mad. They start t CLUCK and rattle their cages. The indoor rainstorm cascades down the bleachers. Plucket men slip and slide down the slick stairs. Other humans st a slippery stampede for the doors. Mack watches happily.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Mad as wet humans.  71. His smile fades as he feels TWO CLAWS sinking into his shoulders. Paulie Crackers has landed on him.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE CRACKERS
dialogues.text: You are nothin’ but trouble. Mack pulls another packet from his pocket - ACME SNEEZE POWDER. He flicks it open as Paulie attacks... and EXPLOD AAAACHOOO! CHOO! CHOO! Helpless Paulie releases Mack... and tumbles off his perch, feathers flying with every sne as he spasms his way to the ground. In the ring, Dag and Penny shout encouragement to the Hen

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Go girls! Rattle those cages! Pluckett slips and slides his way to the plant control pa He punches the “SPRINKLER OFF” button, grabs the “MACHINE lever... and since he’s soaking wet, gets ZAPPED with electricity. General Lee lunges to rescue his master, sin his teeth into Pluckett’s leg -- and gets ZAPPED himself. The sprinklers stop. Pluckett’s weight pulls the lever do The MACHINES START as his hand slips free... HENS SQUAWK as the belt starts moving. The OLD HEN from Dag’s farm is headed for the chute -- but she SQUAWKS and rattles her cage so fiercely, it TIPS OVER THE SIDE... Down below, Pluckett regains consciousness to find Genera Lee frozen in mid-chomp on his ankle. CAP‘N PLUCKETT Let go-a me, you moron! General Lee lets go. Then... WHAM! The Old Hen’s cage dro on Pluckett’s head-- he’s down again. The cage hits the floor... the door SPRINGS OPEN... the Old Hen is amazed a she steps out to freedom.

dialogues.speaker: OLD HEN
dialogues.text: Hey, look at me! (sings) Come on, my fine feathered sisters -- Let's figh the cap'ns and misters! Shake yourselves free, and we Can beat the Man! HENS. But we can’t!

dialogues.speaker: OLD HEN
dialogues.text: Yes we can! More Hens rattle their cages right off the conveyor belt onto Pluckett, his Dog, and his Men. Thunk! Thunk!

dialogues.speaker: OLD HEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No more a henhouse divided-- Let's cross the road with pride!

dialogues.speaker: HENS
dialogues.text: Let's help one another And get to the other side!  72. But one little Hen can’t rattle free -- she’s stuck on th conveyor belt headed for the chute...

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Mack! Help! Dag’s struggling to pull the end of the chicken wire off rooster-pen. Mack flies to help him. RIP! As the little Hen drops off the end of the belt into the fatal chute... Mack swoops and drops the big chicken-wire net. It catches the Hen’s cage... and BLOCKS the end of t chute, More cages drop and get stopped by the blockage -- creating a nice big traffic—jam in e chute. Penny has found her way to a TELEPHONE. She knocks the receiver off the hook and pecks out nine-one-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a DEPUTY answers the phone...

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Police. He recoils from the FRANTIC SQUAWKING at the other end.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, ma’am -- calm down... ASovers phone, shouts) Hey Marshall! We got an emergency, I’m not sure what, but this chick’s in pain. INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY Penny backs away from the © phone as Paulie approaches, s sneezing explosively. eans into the receiver...

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Help-choo! Pluckett’s Poultry-choo! Help, they’re killing us! Choo! Nearby, the Old Hen leads other fallen hens from broken c to the plant door. One Hen carries an egg in her wings...

dialogues.speaker: HEN WITH EGG
dialogues.text: Women and children first! Pluckett spots the hens escaping -- pushes the door-butto and gets SHOCKED again. As the door rolls down, a few hen get trapped. Suddenly they’re caught in a BEAM OF LIGHT..

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: This way, girls! Fly out the window! Dag holds a FLASHLIGHT in his claws, uses it to direct th escapees up a flight of stairs to a small window.

dialogues.speaker: HEN
dialogues.text: We can fly?

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Sure we can. We’ve just denied our true power due to social conditioning!  73. The Hen jumps out the window. THUD! Dag winces -- then explains to the camera: DAG (CONT’D) Without a false sense of security, she’d never have jumped.

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: Help! Help! Dag looks up to see Owleone clutching Flo in his claws, a dives straight for the open window. Thinking fast, Dag ai the flashlight at the old owl’s eyes. Owleone is blinded. His huge pupils shrink to pinpricks - he SHRIEKS in surprise -- and releases his grip on Flo. Before she can unfurl her wings, she’s plummeting to the ground... until Mack swoops down to catch her. FLO (CONT’D) Thanks, Mack. I don’t deserve you.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: You got that right. Owleone CRASHES into cages on the belt. As he recovers, D runs and leaps up to confront him.

dialogues.speaker: DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: Bats! Johnny!

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: (moves in on Owleone) They took off. Not so tough without your hench-bats, are ya? Yeah, you're real tough with the hens and the mice, how ‘bout fighting a rooster your own size? Owleone’s backing away -- then reaches the edge of the be

dialogues.speaker: _ DON OWLEONE
dialogues.text: Okay, just stay coo-hoool... POW! Dag slugs him right in the beak. The Owl goes flying off the conveyor belt -- down the chute -- into oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Arrividerci, Godfeather. BACK TO CAP'N PLUCKETT - as he struggles to his feet...

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: Yo, Pluckett! Bombs away! Pluckett looks up to see Homer hovering awkwardly above. and gets a generous dropping of pigeon-poop in his eyes. Meanwhile, Penny perches on Dag" s back to reach the RING KEYS hanging from distracted Pluckett’s belt-loop. PLOP! Another Homer-bomb lands on General Lee. He GROWLS and LEAPS at Homer, catching the low-flying pigeon off-gu He chomps on Homer’s wing-tip, shakes him back and forth.  74. Mack to the rescue. He lands on the General’s back and wh another packet from his pocket -- ACME ITCHING POWDER. A quick sprinkling over the dog’s back... General Lee freezes -- whines -- releases Homer -- and st SCRATCHING frantically as Mack and Homer make their escap Penny holds the Cap’n’s keyring while Dag pulls off keys tosses them to other Roosters. Dag hugs Penny as he sings

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: I found my chick and unloosed ‘er!

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: But the others are still in a fix. Think there's nobody here but you roosters?

dialogues.speaker: ROOSTERS
dialogues.text: Let's go save some chicks! Dag, Penny and the Roosters flap, hop and run to differen levels of the “prison” and start opening cages. The freed Hens embrace the Roosters -- then scurry to open more cag

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY
dialogues.text: Now we won't stand for slim pickins, Now that we all know the score! There's nobody here but us chickens, And us chickens ain't chicken no more! EXT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - NIGHT Bats and Johnny come in for a landing.

dialogues.speaker: BATS AMORE
dialogues.text: There’s gotta be a way back in... THUMP! Something flies out of a “WASTE” chute in the wall above and lands right in front of the bats. It’s a big ch of deep-fried batter -- shaped just like an owl with wing outstretched. The bats consider their boss’s fried remain

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY GUANO
dialogues.text: Chicken-fried owl. Wonder what that tastes like. (off Bats’s look) I was just wondering. INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY Pluckett is apoplectic -- everywhere he looks, he sees he hopping out of their cages. CAP’N PLUCKETT Stop those chickens! Two of his men climb to the edge of the chute. One lunges catch an escaping Hen and falls onto the cages that clog chute. It’s a little too much weight for the chicken-wire which starts to give way. Another Man starts to climb in.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MAN
dialogues.text: No, don’t help meeeeeee.....  75. Too late. The chicken-wire gives way... and the cages tum down the chute, with Pluckett’s men aboard for the ride. they slide down to oblivion...

dialogues.speaker: DAG / PENNY / CHICKENS
dialogues.text: We're gonna give ‘em a lickin’! We're gonna drive ‘em all nuts! There's nobody here but us chickens -- And us chickens are kickin’ your butts! Woody remains at his microphone amidst the chaos..

dialogues.speaker: WOODY WINCHELL
dialogues.text: It’s an unbelievable scene as chickens take over the poultry plant and their jailers run for cover, oh, the humanity!

dialogues.speaker: HOMER
dialogues.text: (approaching him) Hey, could you help me with something? EXT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - ROOFTOP - NIGHT Woody emerges through a crack in the boarded-up skylight and flies behind the PLUCKETT’S POULTRY billboard, where giant Cap’n’s arm still swings loosely from its bolt. Woo ands and starts pecking at the wood that holds the bolt. RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT... INT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - CONTINUOUS Pluckett rages at the free-ranging prisoners... CAP‘N PLUCKETT You_can’t escape, dang it! May the hand of God strike me down before I’11l be beaten by a buncha bird-brain chickens! CRASH! Pluckett looks up just in time to see... the giant billboard hand crashing through the boards above... into plant machinery. With plenty of GRINDING and SMOKE, it al comes to a halt. The chickens CHEER, CLUCK and CROW.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY
dialogues.text: You better not mess with us chickens, We'll fry ¥ You eventually -- There's nobody here but us chickens, And together we can be free! BLAM! The jubilant MUSIC STOPS abruptly at the sound of a shotgun blast. The Cap’n has fired a warning shot. His remaining Men stand with rifles ready. CAP‘N PLUCKETT Now that is enough-a that. The birds cower from the human weapons. Pluckett draws a bead on Dag and Penny.. CAP'N PLUCKETT (CONT’ D) You two troublemakers ain’t gonna make no more trouble for nobody. As his finger tightens on the trigger... everyone reacts the sound of SIRENS outside.  76.

dialogues.speaker: LOUDSPEAKER VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Open up! Police! Mack flutters up to the door-button and kicks it. The met door rolls up, revealing... POLICE CARS outside, splashing red lights over the night. MARSHALL and Deputy approach Pluckett... CAP‘N PLUCKETT Everything’s fine, Marshall...

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Afraid not, sir. Sponsoring cockfights is a crime in this county. Pluckett turns to face the Marshall, and recognizes...

dialogues.speaker: CAP'N PLUCKETT
dialogues.text: Farmer Farmer?! The Farmer now wears a Marshall’s uniform.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: Marshall Farmer, now. Had to get a new job after you shut us down. Let’s go. He grabs Pluckett’s rifle and produces a pair of handcuff

dialogues.speaker: FARMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just doing my duty, Cap’n, doing my duty. (slapping on the cuffs) You have the right to remain silent. (as Pluckett starts to protest) That means shuddup. Chickens SQUAWK happily as Farmer drags Pluckett out.

dialogues.speaker: CHICKENS
dialogues.text: Shuddup! Shuddup! EXT. PLUCKETT’S POULTRY - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS The plant is a_ circus of red Lights and teeming feathers Farmer perp-walks Pluckett to the police car... followed torrent of hens and roosters, making their escape. Cooney and Poss stand by their tricycle-wagon, pitching:

dialogues.speaker: COONEY
dialogues.text: Step right up, buy 2 a seat on the liberty limousine to freedo As chickens swarm their way, Poss speaks for the first ti

dialogues.speaker: POSS
dialogues.text: This time -- you pedal. Exhausted, he flips onto his back, playing possum. We find our heroes emerging into the night. Penny kisses Dag. Flo kisses Mack. “Homer leans in to kiss Cocky, who gruffly shoves him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re back to Mack and his opening monologue. Now we noti the Treetop Lounge is packed with regulars and NEW CUSTOM the Roosters and Hens from Pluckett’s.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: True story. So now without further ado, ladies an gentlebirds and my little chickadees, here’s the guy you’ve been waiting for. Hey chickens! Wake up! Can we get them some coffee? Here he is, the rooster who coulda been world champion but settled for seit of cock-a- doobie-doobie-doo. He’s still a champ in my books, so make some noise, this kid’s something to crow about -- Dag Nabbit! CHEERS as LIGHTS CHANGE -- we see Dag silhouetted behind curtain. He lets loose with a BRASSY RIFF...

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Bra-ka-kaw! Bra-ka-kaw! Bra-ka-ka-ka-ka- kaw-ka-ka-kaw, yeah! Curtain rises on Dag and band: “NOBODY HERE BUT US CHICKE

dialogues.speaker: DAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some birds are smart as the Yeah! Dickens--

dialogues.speaker: DAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And those birds have smartly Yeah? deduced...

dialogues.speaker: DAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That there's nobody here but us chickens, And us chickens are ruling the roost! Artie takes the vocal as Dag CROWS...

dialogues.speaker: ARTIE CAW
dialogues.text: Yeah! We're alive and we're kickin', Clickin' and cluckin' with glee -- There's nobody here but us crows --

dialogues.speaker: MACK / FLO / DAG
dialogues.text: Mockingbirds! Nightingales! Chickens!

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Nothin' but birds who are free! SPOTLIGHT frames FLO AND MACK: “NEVER TRY TO CLIP MY WING She cuddles him. He’s embarrassed, tries to play to crowd

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: Found a mate -- Worth the wait -- He just might domesticate me...

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Birds, let's fight back! (Flo pecks him Take the night bac. (another love- beck Dlaaca avaneca ne ~peck} ha riaht hack  78. Surrendering to Flo's embrace, Mack gestures “move the sp light! The LIGHT MOVES to DAG AND PENNY: “IF I COULD FLY.

dialogues.speaker: DAG
dialogues.text: Now you and I Are finally together, Birds of a feather, We'll never say goodbye... And it's guaranteed We'll never need To fly. They peck -- and the CURTAIN RISES to reveal the Band, th Chorusbirds, Red, Mack, Flo, Homer, Cocky, even the Peaco

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: (operatically) We're -- here -- with -- the...

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Nightbirds! Here we're allowed to be nightbirds, Yeah and we're proud to be nightbirds, Stay up some night and see... That daybirds are okay birds, But ng thirds are the right birds To be!

dialogues.speaker: PEACOCK
dialogues.text: (off the beat) .-to be!

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes) Pea-brain. (waves to camera) Th-th-th-that’s all folks! IRIS OUT.
